page.title: 01A RURAL SCENE IN SCOTLAND
page.content: Our block can be found on Sheet 74 of the Ordnance Survey 1:50,000 First Series. This area once known as the parish of Gordon(because Gordon was the only village of note) is situated in the S.E. of the Southern Uplands. The block sits on the hills which overlook the N.W.corner of the Tweed Valley.When studied on the O.S. map it can be seen that the area is bisected by the River Eden.There are two main roads which form a crossroads in the centre of the village of Gordon. The A6089 runs N to S. It joins the A68 ten miles further north. This is the main Border road to Edinburgh which is 35 miles from Gordon. The A6105 runs E to W.To the east is Berwick-on-Tweed. The area is predominately arable farm land.Gordon is the only village having a population of a few hundred.
